bioghist.head: Biographical History
bioghist.p: Anna Mireille Abitbol (1908-1995) was born and educated in Oran, Algeria, and went on to study at the Beaux-arts de Paris. She was the youngest exhibitor in the 1937 Paris Salon d'automne. At the onset of World War II she relocated to Morocco, where she regularly exhibited at the Lorenzo Quarello Gallery in Casablanca. In her later life she lived in Los Angeles. Anna Mireille Abitbol died in Los Angeles in 1995.

Danielle Abitbol Avidan was born in Casablanca in 1941. She attended lycée at the College Mers Sultan. Later, she earned an English certificate through the University of Michigan at the American Embassy in Casablanca. In 1979, Danielle Abitbol moved to Los Angeles with her mother Anna Mireille Abitbol and her aunt Edmée Abitbol. Danielle Abitbol married Bernard Avidan in Los Angeles that same year.
